content: DBS Multiplier DBS Bank Account Asked by Huang YixuanAsked on 19 Aug 2019Do I earn Multiplier interest on my other DBS savings account if I have a Multiplier account?So I have a DBS Multiplier Account + DBS credit card + Investment, but I put money into my DBS Savings Account to keep track of savings, do I earn the multiplier interest for ALL my money in DBS or those deposited in Multiplier Account only?1 answerAnswerBump0
Answers (1)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Aik KaiLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 19 Aug 2019Only the multiplier account. Your other accounts earn their own interest rate.Case in point, I have a POSB Savings and DBS Multiplier account. My POSB savings earns 0.05% interest while the Multiplier earns 1.55% to 1.85%.How do I know? Every month, my Multiplier has interest deposited while my POSB savings has nothing deposited other than the end of the year.0 comments1
